title: American women during World War II - describe

content.question: Which of the following is true of American women during the Second World War?

choices.label: They initiated a visible and highly vocal feminist movement.
They married younger and had more children than women did before or after the war.
Those who took industrial jobs learned new skills and earned better pay than in jobs previously open to them.
They organized labor unions and led strikes demanding better working conditions.
Aside from participating in rationing programs, women contributed little to the war effort.

content.answer: Those who took industrial jobs learned new skills and earned better pay than in jobs previously open to them.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
